Description: Copper model axe-head: of rounded form with lugs made of thin sheet metal. It is thickly corroded and bear traces of its original wooden haft. It was once broken in two but is now repaired.
Curator's comments: This axes was found with 15 other models from the same source.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (29)
